extracted-table.table-caption: Hedonic food frequency consumption for the entire population (N = 178) and the subpopulation (N = 50) selected for the brain imaging study.

caption.p: Hedonic food frequency consumption for the entire population (N = 178) and the subpopulation (N = 50) selected for the brain imaging study.

p.italic: PCA, principal component analysis. PCA1 and PCA2 are dependent variables corresponding to the individual projection values on the first two axes of the PCA performed on the food frequency questionnaire data. PTc, prudent-type consumers (N = 25) with the highest values for PCA1 among the 50 selected volunteers. WTc, Western-type consumers (N = 25) with the lowest values for PCA1 among the 50 selected volunteers. na, not applicable. Values in bold are statistically significant for p < 0.05, values in italic are tendencies for 0.05 < p < 0.10.

extracted-table.table-caption: Characterization of the population selected for the brain imaging study (N = 50).

caption.p: Characterization of the population selected for the brain imaging study (N = 50).

p.italic: PCA, principal component analysis. PCA1 and PCA2 are dependent variables corresponding to the individual projection values on the first two axes of the PCA performed on the food frequency questionnaire data. PTc, prudent-type consumers (N = 25) with the highest values for PCA1 among the 50 selected volunteers. WTc, Western-type consumers (N = 25) with the lowest values for PCA1 among the 50 selected volunteers. BMI, body mass index; BMR, basal metabolic rate; fat, body fat composition assessed with a body impedance meter; Ricci-Gagnon, questionnaire assessing physical activity level; SCOFF, TFEQ: Three-factor Eating Questionnaire; CR, cognitive restriction; EE, emotional eating; UE, uncontrolled eating; EOQ, Emotional Overeating Questionnaire; AUDIT, questionnaire assessing drinking patterns; CRAFT, questionnaire assessing substance-related risks and problems. Values in bold are statistically significant for p < 0.05.

extracted-table.table-caption: Functional magnetic resonance imaging wanting task for the second-level analysis in all individuals.

caption.p: Functional magnetic resonance imaging wanting task for the second-level analysis in all individuals.

p.italic: aHeight threshold T = 5.52, pFWE < 0.05, and pUncorr < 0.001 at peak level, df = 1.42, extent threshold: k = 30 voxels, voxel size: 3.0 mm × 3.0 mm × 3.0 mm.

bHeight threshold T = 3.55, pFDR < 0.05 at cluster level, pUncorr < 0.001 at peak level, df = 1.40, extent threshold: k > 125 voxels. L, left; R, right; K, cluster size (number of voxels); SL, similar liking; DL, different liking; FWE, family-wise error correction; FDR, false discovery rate correction; Uncorr, uncorrected p-value.
